intro: Sorindeia mayumbensis, commonly known as the Mayumbé sorindeia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in humid, lowland forests and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native region. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
